A:
abstruse, anachronistic, apocryphal, arcane, artifice, ascetic, atavistic, aegis, ambivalent, anomalous, asperity, augury, axiomatic

B:
bellicose, bombastic, bourgeois, bucolic, byzantine, baleful, beleaguer, blandishment, brevity, bromide, bumptious, burgeoning, bastion

C:
cacophony, cajole, callous, capitulate, catharsis, caustic, chicanery, circumspect, clandestine, coerce, colloquial, conflagration, consanguineous

D:
deleterious, demagogue, denigrate, derivative, despot, diaphanous, dichotomy, didactic, diffident, disparate, dissonance, doctrinaire, dyspeptic

E:
ebullient, eclectic, effervescent, egregious, elucidate, emollient, enervate, enigma, ennui, enthrall, ephemeral, equanimity, ersatz

F:
facetious, fallacious, fastidious, fatuous, feckless, fecund, felicitous, feral, flippant, florid, forbearance, fortuitous, fulminate

G:
garrulous, gestalt, grandiloquent, gregarious, guile, gumption, gustatory, genteel, gainsay, garrulity, gibbous, gratuitous, grimace

H:
hackneyed, hapless, harangue, hedonistic, hegemonic, heterodox, histrionic, hubris, hypocrisy, hyperbole, hypnagogic, halcyon, hallowed

I:
iconoclast, idiosyncratic, ignominious, immutable, impecunious, imperious, impetuous, implacable, implicit, impugn, inchoate, indefatigable, indolent

J:
juxtapose, jargon, jejune, jingoistic, jocular, jovial, judicious, jurisprudence, juvenescent, jubilant, jabberwocky, jackanapes, jactitation

K:
kaleidoscopic, Kafkaesque, karyotype, keening, kenning, kerfuffle, kibitz, kinesiology, knavery, kowtow, karyokinesis, krypton, kindred

L:
laconic, lachrymose, lackadaisical, lambaste, languid, largesse, latent, laudatory, legerdemain, lexicon, libertine, licentious, liminal

M:
machiavellian, maelstrom, magnanimous, malevolent, malinger, malleable, martinet, maudlin, maverick, melancholy, mellifluous, mendacious, mercurial

N:
nebulous, nefarious, nemesis, neophyte, nethermost, nihilism, noisome, nonchalant, nonplussed, nostrum, notoriety, numinous, nugatory

O:
obdurate, obfuscate, oblivion, obsequious, obstinate, odious, officious, omniscient, onerous, opaque, opprobrium, ornate, ostensible

P:
pacifist, palimpsest, panacea, paradigm, paragon, pariah, parsimonious, paucity, pedantic, pellucid, penurious, perfidious, perfunctory

Q:
quagmire, quaint, qualm, quandary, quarrelsome, quash, quell, querulous, quibble, quiescent, quintessential, quip, quixotic

R:
rabble, raconteur, raiment, ramification, rancor, rapacious, rarefied, ratiocinate, recalcitrant, recidivist, redolent, refractory, remonstrate

S:
sacrosanct, sagacious, salient, salubrious, sanguine, sardonic, sartorial, scintilla, scurrilous, sedulous, sententious, serendipity, sibilant

T:
taciturn, tantamount, temerity, tenacious, tendentious, tergiversate, terse, timorous, torpid, tortuous, trenchant, truculent, turgid

U:
ubiquitous, ulterior, umbrage, unctuous, undulate, unfathomable, ungainly, unimpeachable, unobtrusive, unprecedented, unremitting, untoward, uxorious

V:
vacillate, vacuous, valedictory, vanguard, vehement, venal, veracity, verbose, verdant, verisimilitude, veritable, vestige, vicissitude

W:
wanton, waver, welter, whimsical, winsome, wistful, wizened, woebegone, wonderment, wrangle, wretched, writhe, wunderkind

X:
xenial, xenophobia, xeric, xerophyte, xiphoid, xylograph, xylophone, xenogenesis, xanthic, xenotropic, xenolithic, xenocryst, xenogamy

Y:
yammer, yare, yawp, yearn, yeoman, yokel, yonder, youthful, ytterbium, yuga, yawl, yachtsman, yardarm

Z:
zealot, zeitgeist, zenith, zephyr, zeroth, zestful, ziggurat, zilch, zinciferous, zirconium, zither, zoophagous, zymurgy
